text: The great music quality reminds me of a little game i played where you had to make games. It was pretty simple and you had to hire programmers, writers, musicians, and artists i think. author: Angel L

text: Well first you might conceptualize what you want to capture and then follow through, and capture it. Just like a good book, a good song, if complicated, is built from the expansion-and-follow up of upon a concrete conceptual(imagined) happening. Like, imagine something in your head, and now find and make sounds that "feel" like they are of that thing. And for a song like this, it's a complicated multi-staged happening. For example like, romeo and juliet or someshit has different "feeling" at each arc of the story. And they blend and re-play as to make the experience more digestible.

text: No matter how much a main series Sonic game can fail, they always will have one kickass soundtrack.
author: Matheus Moura

text: Ahem, SONIC CHRONICLES, SONIC GAMESCOM...
author: A. Ahmou

text: +A. Ahmou The Chronicles game was made by Bioware, creator of Mass Effect, so blame them for that shitty soundtrack because they did all the music. Also what is Sonic Gamescom? I googled it and that doesn't even seem to exist. Every Sega produced Sonic game has an amazing soundtrack end of story.
author: RydazRuff

text: @***** Sonic Boom have a lot of generic music, but to be honest, none of them are bad... And yeah, it does have some cool songs in it too~
author: Matheus Moura

text:
+RydazRuff Actually Chronicles' soundtrack was made by Richard jaques, who made the music for Sonic R and 3D Blast on the Saturn, both sonic boom games as well as black knight.
The game was released in a rather unfinished state, which explains the Gameboy-esque music and the poor cutscenes and character models.
author: CarozQH

text: @***** Game boy-esque. And yes, i meant chronicles.
author: CarozQH

text: @***** Boom is a spin-off.
author: Matheus Moura

text:
@***** I'm not saying every spin-off has bad music, did I say that?
Just saying that "minus Boom" doesn't make sense because it isn't a main series game.
author: Matheus Moura

text: I haven't played a game in this franchise in a long while, but I keep up with their soundtracks since they are always top tier. Lost World is no different, with this specific theme being one of my favorites in the whole series. Great piano and strings backed with a nice beat, gotta love it.
